feed.title: APCSP
feed.subtitle: AP Computer Science Principles course materials.

entry.title: Python Web API Tutorial
entry.summary: A discussion on Web APIs. This will include Python at the center of using 3rd party APIs (like RapidAPI), creating APIs (like Jokes), and creating API that work with persistent databases (like SQLite).

entry.title: Query Graph Database
entry.summary: A description of the data, and then how to connect and query the database.

entry.title: Deployment Guide
entry.summary: Description of key methods process used to deploy a Flask/Python website; AWS EC2, Docker, docker-compose, and Nginx

entry.title: Bash Tutorial
entry.summary: A brief overview of Bash, on your way to becoming a Linux expert. When a computer boots up, a kernel (MacOS, Windows, Linux) is started. This kernel provides a shell that allows user to interact with a most basic set of commands. Typically, the casual user will not interact with the shell as a Desktop User Interface is started by the computer boot up process. To activate the shell directly, users will run a "terminal" through the Desktop, VS Code or activate "console" while on a cloud computer like AWS.

entry.title: Calculator Starters
entry.summary: A common way to become familiar with a language is to build a calculator. This calculator shows off button with actions.
